an8.41:0.3.eng: The Sabbath With Eight Factors, In Brief

an8.41:1.2.pli: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
an8.41:1.2.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.

an8.41:1.3.eng: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants,

an8.41:2.1.pli: “Aṭṭhaṅgasamannāgato, bhikkhave, uposatho upavuttho mahapphalo hoti mahānisaṃso mahājutiko mahāvipphāro.
an8.41:2.1.eng: “Mendicants, the observance of the sabbath with its eight factors is very fruitful and beneficial and dazzling and bountiful.

an8.41:2.2.pli: Kathaṃ upavuttho ca, bhikkhave, aṭṭhaṅgasamannāgato uposatho mahapphalo hoti mahānisaṃso mahājutiko mahāvipphāro?
an8.41:2.2.eng: And how should it be observed?

an8.41:2.3.eng: It’s when a noble disciple reflects:

an8.41:2.4.pli: ‘yāvajīvaṃ arahanto pāṇātipātaṃ pahāya pāṇātipātā paṭiviratā nihitadaṇḍā nihitasatthā lajjī dayāpannā, sabbapāṇabhūtahitānukampino viharanti.
an8.41:2.4.eng: ‘As long as they live, the perfected ones give up killing living creatures, renouncing the rod and the sword. They are scrupulous and kind, and live full of sympathy for all living beings.

an8.41:2.5.pli: Ahampajja imañca rattiṃ imañca divasaṃ pāṇātipātaṃ pahāya pāṇātipātā paṭivirato nihitadaṇḍo nihitasattho lajjī dayāpanno, sabbapāṇabhūtahitānukampī viharāmi.
an8.41:2.5.eng: I, too, for this day and night will give up killing living creatures, renouncing the rod and the sword. I’ll be scrupulous and kind, and live full of sympathy for all living beings.

an8.41:2.6.pli: Imināpaṅgena arahataṃ anukaromi, uposatho ca me upavuttho bhavissatī’ti.
an8.41:2.6.eng: I will observe the sabbath by doing as the perfected ones do in this respect.’

an8.41:3.1.pli: ‘Yāvajīvaṃ arahanto adinnādānaṃ pahāya adinnādānā paṭiviratā dinnādāyī dinnapāṭikaṅkhī, athenena sucibhūtena attanā viharanti.
an8.41:3.1.eng: ‘As long as they live, the perfected ones give up stealing. They take only what’s given, and expect only what’s given. They keep themselves clean by not thieving.

an8.41:3.2.pli: Ahampajja imañca rattiṃ imañca divasaṃ adinnādānaṃ pahāya adinnādānā paṭivirato dinnādāyī dinnapāṭikaṅkhī, athenena sucibhūtena attanā viharāmi.
an8.41:3.2.eng: I, too, for this day and night will give up stealing. I’ll take only what’s given, and expect only what’s given. I’ll keep myself clean by not thieving.

an8.41:3.3.pli: Imināpaṅgena arahataṃ anukaromi, uposatho ca me upavuttho bhavissatī’ti.
an8.41:3.3.eng: I will observe the sabbath by doing as the perfected ones do in this respect.’

an8.41:4.1.pli: ‘Yāvajīvaṃ arahanto abrahmacariyaṃ pahāya brahmacārino ārācārino viratā methunā gāmadhammā.
an8.41:4.1.eng: ‘As long as they live, the perfected ones give up unchastity. They are chaste, set apart, avoiding the vulgar act of sex.

an8.41:4.2.pli: Ahampajja imañca rattiṃ imañca divasaṃ abrahmacariyaṃ pahāya brahmacārī ārācārī virato methunā gāmadhammā.
an8.41:4.2.eng: I, too, for this day and night will give up unchastity. I will be chaste, set apart, avoiding the vulgar act of sex.

an8.41:4.3.pli: Imināpaṅgena arahataṃ anukaromi, uposatho ca me upavuttho bhavissatī’ti.
an8.41:4.3.eng: I will observe the sabbath by doing as the perfected ones do in this respect.’

an8.41:5.1.pli: ‘Yāvajīvaṃ arahanto musāvādaṃ pahāya musāvādā paṭiviratā saccavādino saccasandhā thetā paccayikā avisaṃvādako lokassa.
an8.41:5.1.eng: ‘As long as they live, the perfected ones give up lying. They speak the truth and stick to the truth. They’re honest and dependable, and don’t trick the world with their words.

an8.41:5.2.pli: Ahampajja imañca rattiṃ imañca divasaṃ musāvādaṃ pahāya musāvādā paṭivirato saccavādī saccasandho theto paccayiko avisaṃvādako lokassa.
an8.41:5.2.eng: I, too, for this day and night will give up lying. I’ll speak the truth and stick to the truth. I’ll be honest and dependable, and won’t trick the world with my words.

an8.41:5.3.pli: Imināpaṅgena arahataṃ anukaromi, uposatho ca me upavuttho bhavissatī’ti.
an8.41:5.3.eng: I will observe the sabbath by doing as the perfected ones do in this respect.’

an8.41:6.1.eng: ‘As long as they live, the perfected ones give up beer, wine, and liquor intoxicants.

an8.41:6.2.pli: Ahampajja imañca rattiṃ imañca divasaṃ surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānaṃ pahāya surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānā paṭivirato.
an8.41:6.2.eng: I, too, for this day and night will give up beer, wine, and liquor intoxicants.

an8.41:6.3.pli: Imināpaṅgena arahataṃ anukaromi, uposatho ca me upavuttho bhavissatī’ti.
an8.41:6.3.eng: I will observe the sabbath by doing as the perfected ones do in this respect.’

an8.41:7.1.eng: ‘As long as they live, the perfected ones eat in one part of the day, abstaining from eating at night and from food at the wrong time.

an8.41:7.2.pli: Ahampajja imañca rattiṃ imañca divasaṃ ekabhattiko rattūparato virato vikālabhojanā.
an8.41:7.2.eng: I, too, for this day and night will eat in one part of the day, abstaining from eating at night and food at the wrong time.

an8.41:7.3.pli: Imināpaṅgena arahataṃ anukaromi, uposatho ca me upavuttho bhavissatī’ti.
an8.41:7.3.eng: I will observe the sabbath by doing as the perfected ones do in this respect.’

an8.41:8.1.eng: ‘As long as they live, the perfected ones give up seeing shows of dancing, singing, and music ; and attiring and adorning themselves with garlands, fragrance, and makeup.

an8.41:8.2.pli: Ahampajja imañca rattiṃ imañca divasaṃ naccagītavāditavisūkadassanamālāgandhavilepanadhāraṇamaṇḍanavibhūsanaṭṭhānaṃ pahāya naccagītavāditavisūkadassanamālāgandhavilepanadhāraṇamaṇḍanavibhūsanaṭṭhānā paṭivirato.
an8.41:8.2.eng: I, too, for this day and night will give up seeing shows of dancing, singing, and music ; and attiring and adorning myself with garlands, fragrance, and makeup.

an8.41:8.3.pli: Imināpaṅgena arahataṃ anukaromi, uposatho ca me upavuttho bhavissatī’ti.
an8.41:8.3.eng: I will observe the sabbath by doing as the perfected ones do in this respect.’

an8.41:9.1.pli: ‘Yāvajīvaṃ arahanto uccāsayanamahāsayanaṃ pahāya uccāsayanamahāsayanā paṭiviratā nīcaseyyaṃ kappenti—mañcake vā tiṇasanthārake vā.
an8.41:9.1.eng: ‘As long as they live, the perfected ones give up high and luxurious beds. They sleep in a low place, either a cot or a straw mat.

an8.41:9.2.pli: Ahampajja imañca rattiṃ imañca divasaṃ uccāsayanamahāsayanaṃ pahāya uccāsayanamahāsayanā paṭivirato nīcaseyyaṃ kappemi—mañcake vā tiṇasanthārake vā.
an8.41:9.2.eng: I, too, for this day and night will give up high and luxurious beds. I’ll sleep in a low place, either a cot or a straw mat.

an8.41:9.3.pli: Imināpaṅgena arahataṃ anukaromi, uposatho ca me upavuttho bhavissatī’ti.
an8.41:9.3.eng: I will observe the sabbath by doing as the perfected ones do in this respect.’

an8.41:10.1.pli: Evaṃ upavuttho kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭhaṅgasamannāgato uposatho mahapphalo hoti mahānisaṃso mahājutiko mahāvipphāro”ti.
an8.41:10.1.eng: The observance of the sabbath with its eight factors in this way is very fruitful and beneficial and dazzling and bountiful.”

an8.42:0.3.eng: The Sabbath With Eight Factors, In Detail

an8.42:1.1.pli: “Aṭṭhaṅgasamannāgato, bhikkhave, uposatho upavuttho mahapphalo hoti mahānisaṃso mahājutiko mahāvipphāro.
an8.42:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, the observance of the sabbath with its eight factors is very fruitful and beneficial and dazzling and bountiful.

an8.42:1.2.pli: Kathaṃ upavuttho ca, bhikkhave, aṭṭhaṅgasamannāgato uposatho mahapphalo hoti mahānisaṃso mahājutiko mahāvipphāro?
an8.42:1.2.eng: And how should it be observed?

an8.42:1.3.eng: It’s when a noble disciple reflects:

an8.42:1.4.pli: ‘yāvajīvaṃ arahanto pāṇātipātaṃ pahāya pāṇātipātā paṭiviratā nihitadaṇḍā nihitasatthā lajjī dayāpannā, sabbapāṇabhūtahitānukampino viharanti.
an8.42:1.4.eng: ‘As long as they live, the perfected ones give up killing living creatures, renouncing the rod and the sword. They are scrupulous and kind, and live full of sympathy for all living beings.

an8.42:1.5.pli: Ahampajja imañca rattiṃ imañca divasaṃ pāṇātipātaṃ pahāya pāṇātipātā paṭivirato nihitadaṇḍo nihitasattho lajjī dayāpanno, sabbapāṇabhūtahitānukampī viharāmi.
an8.42:1.5.eng: I, too, for this day and night will give up killing living creatures, renouncing the rod and the sword. I’ll be scrupulous and kind, and live full of sympathy for all living beings.

an8.42:1.6.pli: Imināpaṅgena arahataṃ anukaromi, uposatho ca me upavuttho bhavissatī’ti.
an8.42:1.6.eng: I will observe the sabbath by doing as the perfected ones do in this respect.’

an8.42:2.1.pli: ‘Yāvajīvaṃ arahanto uccāsayanamahāsayanaṃ pahāya uccāsayanamahāsayanā paṭiviratā nīcaseyyaṃ kappenti—mañcake vā tiṇasanthārake vā.
an8.42:2.1.eng: ‘As long as they live, the perfected ones give up high and luxurious beds. They sleep in a low place, either a cot or a straw mat.

an8.42:2.2.pli: Ahampajja imañca rattiṃ imañca divasaṃ uccāsayanamahāsayanaṃ pahāya uccāsayanamahāsayanā paṭivirato nīcaseyyaṃ kappemi—mañcake vā tiṇasanthārake vā.
an8.42:2.2.eng: I, too, for this day and night will give up high and luxurious beds. I’ll sleep in a low place, either a cot or a straw mat.

an8.42:2.3.pli: Imināpaṅgena arahataṃ anukaromi, uposatho ca me upavuttho bhavissatī’ti.
an8.42:2.3.eng: I will observe the sabbath by doing as the perfected ones do in this respect.’

an8.42:2.5.pli: Evaṃ upavuttho kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭhaṅgasamannāgato uposatho mahapphalo hoti mahānisaṃso mahājutiko mahāvipphāro.
an8.42:2.5.eng: The observance of the sabbath with its eight factors in this way is very fruitful and beneficial and dazzling and bountiful.

an8.42:3.2.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, yo imesaṃ soḷasannaṃ mahājanapadānaṃ pahūtarattaratanānaṃ issariyādhipaccaṃ rajjaṃ kāreyya, seyyathidaṃ—
an8.42:3.2.eng: Suppose you were to rule as sovereign lord over these sixteen great countries—Aṅga, Magadha, Kāsi, Kosala, Vajji, Malla, Cetī, Vaccha, Kuru, Pañcāla, Maccha, Sūrasena, Assaka, Avanti, Gandhāra, and Kamboja—full of the seven kinds of precious things.

an8.42:3.3.pli: aṅgānaṃ magadhānaṃ kāsīnaṃ kosalānaṃ vajjīnaṃ mallānaṃ cetīnaṃ vaṅgānaṃ kurūnaṃ pañcālānaṃ macchānaṃ sūrasenānaṃ assakānaṃ avantīnaṃ gandhārānaṃ kambojānaṃ, aṭṭhaṅgasamannāgatassa uposathassa etaṃ kalaṃ nāgghati soḷasiṃ.
an8.42:3.3.eng: This wouldn’t be worth a sixteenth part of the sabbath with its eight factors.

an8.42:3.5.pli: Kapaṇaṃ, bhikkhave, mānusakaṃ rajjaṃ dibbaṃ sukhaṃ upanidhāya.
an8.42:3.5.eng: Because human kingship is a poor thing compared to the happiness of the gods.

an8.42:4.1.pli: Yāni, bhikkhave, mānusakāni paññāsa vassāni, cātumahārājikānaṃ devānaṃ eso eko rattindivo.
an8.42:4.1.eng: Fifty years in the human realm is one day and night for the gods of the four great kings.

an8.42:4.2.eng: Thirty such days make up a month.

an8.42:4.3.eng: Twelve such months make up a year.

an8.42:4.4.pli: Tena saṃvaccharena dibbāni pañca vassasatāni cātumahārājikānaṃ devānaṃ āyuppamāṇaṃ.
an8.42:4.4.eng: The lifespan of the gods of the four great kings is five hundred of these heavenly years.

an8.42:4.5.pli: Ṭhānaṃ kho panetaṃ, bhikkhave, vijjati yaṃ idhekacco itthī vā puriso vā aṭṭhaṅgasamannāgataṃ uposathaṃ upavasitvā kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā cātumahārājikānaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjeyya.
an8.42:4.5.eng: It’s possible that some woman or man who has observed the eight-factored sabbath will—when their body breaks up, after death—be reborn in the company of the gods of the four great kings.

an8.42:4.6.pli: Idaṃ kho panetaṃ, bhikkhave, sandhāya bhāsitaṃ:
an8.42:4.6.eng: This is what I was referring to when I said:

an8.42:4.7.eng: ‘Human kingship is a poor thing compared to the happiness of the gods.’

an8.42:5.1.pli: Yāni, bhikkhave, mānusakāni vassasatāni, tāvatiṃsānaṃ devānaṃ eso eko rattindivo.
an8.42:5.1.eng: A hundred years in the human realm is one day and night for the gods of the thirty-three.

an8.42:5.2.eng: Thirty such days make up a month.

an8.42:5.3.eng: Twelve such months make up a year.

an8.42:5.4.pli: Tena saṃvaccharena dibbaṃ vassasahassaṃ tāvatiṃsānaṃ devānaṃ āyuppamāṇaṃ.
an8.42:5.4.eng: The lifespan of the gods of the thirty-three is a thousand of these heavenly years.

an8.42:5.5.pli: Ṭhānaṃ kho panetaṃ, bhikkhave, vijjati yaṃ idhekacco itthī vā puriso vā aṭṭhaṅgasamannāgataṃ uposathaṃ upavasitvā kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā tāvatiṃsānaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjeyya.
an8.42:5.5.eng: It’s possible that some woman or man who has observed the eight-factored sabbath will—when their body breaks up, after death—be reborn in the company of the gods of the thirty-three.

an8.42:5.6.pli: Idaṃ kho panetaṃ, bhikkhave, sandhāya bhāsitaṃ:
an8.42:5.6.eng: This is what I was referring to when I said:

an8.42:5.7.eng: ‘Human kingship is a poor thing compared to the happiness of the gods.’

an8.42:6.1.pli: Yāni, bhikkhave, mānusakāni dve vassasatāni, yāmānaṃ devānaṃ eso eko rattindivo.
an8.42:6.1.eng: Two hundred years in the human realm is one day and night for the gods of Yama.

an8.42:6.2.eng: Thirty such days make up a month.

an8.42:6.3.eng: Twelve such months make up a year.

an8.42:6.4.pli: Tena saṃvaccharena dibbāni dve vassasahassāni yāmānaṃ devānaṃ āyuppamāṇaṃ.
an8.42:6.4.eng: The lifespan of the gods of Yama is two thousand of these heavenly years.

an8.42:6.5.pli: Ṭhānaṃ kho panetaṃ, bhikkhave, vijjati yaṃ idhekacco itthī vā puriso vā aṭṭhaṅgasamannāgataṃ uposathaṃ upavasitvā kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā yāmānaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjeyya.
an8.42:6.5.eng: It’s possible that some woman or man who has observed the eight-factored sabbath will—when their body breaks up, after death—be reborn in the company of the gods of Yama.

an8.42:6.6.pli: Idaṃ kho panetaṃ, bhikkhave, sandhāya bhāsitaṃ:
an8.42:6.6.eng: This is what I was referring to when I said:

an8.42:6.7.eng: ‘Human kingship is a poor thing compared to the happiness of the gods.’

an8.42:7.1.pli: Yāni, bhikkhave, mānusakāni cattāri vassasatāni, tusitānaṃ devānaṃ eso eko rattindivo.
an8.42:7.1.eng: Four hundred years in the human realm is one day and night for the joyful gods.

an8.42:7.2.eng: Thirty such days make up a month.

an8.42:7.3.eng: Twelve such months make up a year.

an8.42:7.4.pli: Tena saṃvaccharena dibbāni cattāri vassasahassāni tusitānaṃ devānaṃ āyuppamāṇaṃ.
an8.42:7.4.eng: The lifespan of the joyful gods is four thousand of these heavenly years.

an8.42:7.5.pli: Ṭhānaṃ kho panetaṃ, bhikkhave, vijjati yaṃ idhekacco itthī vā puriso vā aṭṭhaṅgasamannāgataṃ uposathaṃ upavasitvā kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā tusitānaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjeyya.
an8.42:7.5.eng: It’s possible that some woman or man who has observed the eight-factored sabbath will—when their body breaks up, after death—be reborn in the company of the joyful gods.

an8.42:7.6.pli: Idaṃ kho panetaṃ, bhikkhave, sandhāya bhāsitaṃ:
an8.42:7.6.eng: This is what I was referring to when I said:

an8.42:7.7.eng: ‘Human kingship is a poor thing compared to the happiness of the gods.’

an8.42:8.1.pli: Yāni, bhikkhave, mānusakāni aṭṭha vassasatāni, nimmānaratīnaṃ devānaṃ eso eko rattindivo.
an8.42:8.1.eng: Eight hundred years in the human realm is one day and night for the gods who love to create.

an8.42:8.2.eng: Thirty such days make up a month.

an8.42:8.3.eng: Twelve such months make up a year.

an8.42:8.4.pli: Tena saṃvaccharena dibbāni aṭṭha vassasahassāni nimmānaratīnaṃ devānaṃ āyuppamāṇaṃ.
an8.42:8.4.eng: The life span of the gods who love to create is eight thousand of these heavenly years.

an8.42:8.5.pli: Ṭhānaṃ kho panetaṃ, bhikkhave, vijjati yaṃ idhekacco itthī vā puriso vā aṭṭhaṅgasamannāgataṃ uposathaṃ upavasitvā kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā nimmānaratīnaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjeyya.
an8.42:8.5.eng: It’s possible that some woman or man who has observed the eight-factored sabbath will—when their body breaks up, after death—be reborn in the company of the gods who love to create.

an8.42:8.6.pli: Idaṃ kho panetaṃ, bhikkhave, sandhāya bhāsitaṃ:
an8.42:8.6.eng: This is what I was referring to when I said:

an8.42:8.7.eng: ‘Human kingship is a poor thing compared to the happiness of the gods.’

an8.42:9.1.pli: Yāni, bhikkhave, mānusakāni soḷasa vassasatāni, paranimmitavasavattīnaṃ devānaṃ eso eko rattindivo.
an8.42:9.1.eng: Sixteen hundred years in the human realm is one day and night for the gods who control what is created by others.

an8.42:9.2.eng: Thirty such days make up a month.

an8.42:9.3.eng: Twelve such months make up a year.

an8.42:9.4.pli: Tena saṃvaccharena dibbāni soḷasa vassasahassāni paranimmitavasavattīnaṃ devānaṃ āyuppamāṇaṃ.
an8.42:9.4.eng: The life span of the gods who control what is created by others is sixteen thousand of these heavenly years.

an8.42:9.5.pli: Ṭhānaṃ kho panetaṃ, bhikkhave, vijjati yaṃ idhekacco itthī vā puriso vā aṭṭhaṅgasamannāgataṃ uposathaṃ upavasitvā kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā paranimmitavasavattīnaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjeyya.
an8.42:9.5.eng: It’s possible that some woman or man who has observed the eight-factored sabbath will—when their body breaks up, after death—be reborn in the company of the gods who control what is created by others.

an8.42:9.6.pli: Idaṃ kho panetaṃ, bhikkhave, sandhāya bhāsitaṃ:
an8.42:9.6.eng: This is what I was referring to when I said:

an8.42:9.7.eng: ‘Human kingship is a poor thing compared to the happiness of the gods.’

an8.42:10.1.eng: You shouldn’t kill living creatures, or steal,

an8.42:10.2.pli: Musā na bhāse na ca majjapo siyā;

an8.42:10.4.eng: and don’t eat at night, the wrong time.

an8.42:11.1.pli: Mālaṃ na dhāre na ca gandhamācare,
an8.42:11.1.eng: Not wearing garlands or applying fragrance,

an8.42:11.2.eng: you should sleep on a low bed, <j>or a mat on the ground.

an8.42:11.3.eng: This is the eight-factored sabbath, they say,

an8.42:11.4.eng: explained by the Buddha, <j>who has gone to suffering’s end.

an8.42:12.1.pli: Cando ca suriyo ca ubho sudassanā,
an8.42:12.1.eng: The moon and sun are both fair to see,

an8.42:12.2.eng: radiating as far as they revolve.

an8.42:12.3.eng: Those dispellers of darkness, travellers in midair,

an8.42:12.4.eng: shine in the firmament, lighting up the quarters.

an8.42:13.1.eng: All of the wealth that’s found in this realm—

an8.42:14.1.eng: they’re not worth a sixteenth part

an8.42:14.2.eng: of the sabbath with its eight factors,

an8.42:14.3.eng: as starlight cannot rival the moon.

an8.42:15.1.pli: Tasmā hi nārī ca naro ca sīlavā,
an8.42:15.1.eng: So an ethical woman or man,

an8.42:15.2.eng: who has observed the eight-factored sabbath,

an8.42:15.3.eng: having made merit whose outcome is happiness,

an8.42:15.4.eng: blameless, they go to a heavenly place.”

an8.43:1.1.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati pubbārāme migāramātupāsāde.
an8.43:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in the stilt longhouse of Migāra’s mother in the Eastern Monastery.

an8.43:1.2.pli: Atha kho visākhā migāramātā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho visākhaṃ migāramātaraṃ bhagavā etadavoca:
an8.43:1.2.eng: Then Visākhā, Migāra’s mother, went up to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down to one side. The Buddha said to her:

an8.43:1.3.pli: “aṭṭhaṅgasamannāgato kho, visākhe, uposatho upavuttho mahapphalo hoti mahānisaṃso mahājutiko mahāvipphāro.
an8.43:1.3.eng: “Visākhā, the observance of the sabbath with its eight factors is very fruitful and beneficial and dazzling and bountiful.

an8.43:1.4.pli: Kathaṃ upavuttho ca, visākhe, aṭṭhaṅgasamannāgato uposatho mahapphalo hoti mahānisaṃso mahājutiko mahāvipphāro?
an8.43:1.4.eng: And how should it be observed?

an8.43:1.5.eng: It’s when a noble disciple reflects:

an8.43:1.6.pli: ‘yāvajīvaṃ arahanto pāṇātipātaṃ pahāya pāṇātipātā paṭiviratā nihitadaṇḍā nihitasatthā lajjī dayāpannā, sabbapāṇabhūtahitānukampino viharanti.
an8.43:1.6.eng: ‘As long as they live, the perfected ones give up killing living creatures, renouncing the rod and the sword. They are scrupulous and kind, and live full of sympathy for all living beings.

an8.43:1.7.pli: Ahampajja imañca rattiṃ imañca divasaṃ pāṇātipātaṃ pahāya pāṇātipātā paṭivirato nihitadaṇḍo nihitasattho lajjī dayāpanno, sabbapāṇabhūtahitānukampī viharāmi.
an8.43:1.7.eng: I, too, for this day and night will give up killing living creatures, renouncing the rod and the sword. I’ll be scrupulous and kind, and live full of sympathy for all living beings.

an8.43:1.8.pli: Imināpaṅgena arahataṃ anukaromi, uposatho ca me upavuttho bhavissatī’ti.
an8.43:1.8.eng: I will observe the sabbath by doing as the perfected ones do in this respect.’

an8.43:2.1.pli: ‘Yāvajīvaṃ arahanto uccāsayanamahāsayanaṃ pahāya uccāsayanamahāsayanā paṭiviratā nīcaseyyaṃ kappenti—mañcake vā tiṇasanthārake vā.
an8.43:2.1.eng: ‘As long as they live, the perfected ones give up high and luxurious beds. They sleep in a low place, either a cot or a straw mat.

an8.43:2.2.pli: Ahampajja imañca rattiṃ imañca divasaṃ uccāsayanamahāsayanaṃ pahāya uccāsayanamahāsayanā paṭivirato nīcaseyyaṃ kappemi—mañcake vā tiṇasanthārake vā.
an8.43:2.2.eng: I, too, for this day and night will give up high and luxurious beds. I’ll sleep in a low place, either a cot or a straw mat.

an8.43:2.3.pli: Imināpaṅgena arahataṃ anukaromi, uposatho ca me upavuttho bhavissatī’ti.
an8.43:2.3.eng: I will observe the sabbath by doing as the perfected ones do in this respect.’

an8.43:2.5.pli: Evaṃ upavuttho kho, visākhe, aṭṭhaṅgasamannāgato uposatho mahapphalo hoti mahānisaṃso mahājutiko mahāvipphāro.
an8.43:2.5.eng: The observance of the sabbath with its eight factors in this way is very fruitful and beneficial and dazzling and bountiful.

an8.43:3.2.pli: Seyyathāpi, visākhe, yo imesaṃ soḷasannaṃ mahājanapadānaṃ pahūtarattaratanānaṃ issariyādhipaccaṃ rajjaṃ kāreyya, seyyathidaṃ—
an8.43:3.2.eng: Suppose you were to rule as sovereign lord over these sixteen great countries—Aṅga, Magadha, Kāsi, Kosala, Vajji, Malla, Cetī, Vaccha, Kuru, Pañcāla, Maccha, Sūrasena, Assaka, Avanti, Gandhāra, and Kamboja—full of the seven kinds of precious things.

an8.43:3.3.pli: aṅgānaṃ magadhānaṃ kāsīnaṃ kosalānaṃ vajjīnaṃ mallānaṃ cetīnaṃ vaṅgānaṃ kurūnaṃ pañcālānaṃ macchānaṃ sūrasenānaṃ assakānaṃ avantīnaṃ gandhārānaṃ kambojānaṃ, aṭṭhaṅgasamannāgatassa uposathassa etaṃ kalaṃ nāgghati soḷasiṃ.
an8.43:3.3.eng: This wouldn’t be worth a sixteenth part of the sabbath with its eight factors.

an8.43:3.5.pli: Kapaṇaṃ, visākhe, mānusakaṃ rajjaṃ dibbaṃ sukhaṃ upanidhāya.
an8.43:3.5.eng: Because human kingship is a poor thing compared to the happiness of the gods.

an8.43:4.1.pli: Yāni, visākhe, mānusakāni paññāsa vassāni, cātumahārājikānaṃ devānaṃ eso eko rattindivo.
an8.43:4.1.eng: Fifty years in the human realm is one day and night for the gods of the four great kings.

an8.43:4.2.eng: Thirty such days make up a month.

an8.43:4.3.eng: Twelve such months make up a year.

an8.43:4.4.pli: Tena saṃvaccharena dibbāni pañca vassasatāni cātumahārājikānaṃ devānaṃ āyuppamāṇaṃ.
an8.43:4.4.eng: The lifespan of the gods of the four great kings is five hundred of these heavenly years.

an8.43:4.5.pli: Ṭhānaṃ kho panetaṃ, visākhe, vijjati yaṃ idhekacco itthī vā puriso vā aṭṭhaṅgasamannāgataṃ uposathaṃ upavasitvā kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā cātumahārājikānaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjeyya.
an8.43:4.5.eng: It’s possible that some woman or man who has observed the eight-factored sabbath will—when their body breaks up, after death—be reborn in the company of the gods of the four great kings.

an8.43:4.6.pli: Idaṃ kho panetaṃ, visākhe, sandhāya bhāsitaṃ:
an8.43:4.6.eng: This is what I was referring to when I said:

an8.43:4.7.eng: ‘Human kingship is a poor thing compared to the happiness of the gods.’

an8.43:5.1.pli: Yaṃ, visākhe, mānusakaṃ vassasataṃ, tāvatiṃsānaṃ devānaṃ eso eko rattindivo.
an8.43:5.1.eng: A hundred years in the human realm is one day and night for the gods of the thirty-three.

an8.43:5.2.eng: Thirty such days make up a month.

an8.43:5.3.eng: Twelve such months make up a year.

an8.43:5.4.pli: Tena saṃvaccharena vassasahassaṃ tāvatiṃsānaṃ devānaṃ āyuppamāṇaṃ.
an8.43:5.4.eng: The lifespan of the gods of the thirty-three is a thousand of these divine years.

an8.43:5.5.pli: Ṭhānaṃ kho panetaṃ, visākhe, vijjati yaṃ idhekacco itthī vā puriso vā aṭṭhaṅgasamannāgataṃ uposathaṃ upavasitvā kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā tāvatiṃsānaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjeyya.
an8.43:5.5.eng: It’s possible that some woman or man who has observed the eight-factored sabbath will—when their body breaks up, after death—be reborn in the company of the gods of the thirty-three.

an8.43:5.6.pli: Idaṃ kho panetaṃ, visākhe, sandhāya bhāsitaṃ:
an8.43:5.6.eng: This is what I was referring to when I said:

an8.43:5.7.eng: ‘Human kingship is a poor thing compared to the happiness of the gods.’

an8.43:6.1.eng: Two hundred years in the human realm …

an8.43:6.2.eng: Four hundred years in the human realm …

an8.43:6.3.eng: Eight hundred years in the human realm …

an8.43:6.4.pli: soḷasa vassasatāni paranimmitavasavattīnaṃ devānaṃ eso eko rattindivo.
an8.43:6.4.eng: Sixteen hundred years in the human realm is one day and night for the gods who control what is created by others.

an8.43:6.5.eng: Thirty such days make up a month.

an8.43:6.6.eng: Twelve such months make up a year.

an8.43:6.7.pli: Tena saṃvaccharena dibbāni soḷasa vassasahassāni paranimmitavasavattīnaṃ devānaṃ āyuppamāṇaṃ.
an8.43:6.7.eng: The life span of the gods who control what is created by others is sixteen thousand of these heavenly years.

an8.43:6.8.pli: Ṭhānaṃ kho panetaṃ, visākhe, vijjati yaṃ idhekacco itthī vā puriso vā aṭṭhaṅgasamannāgataṃ uposathaṃ upavasitvā kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā paranimmitavasavattīnaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjeyya.
an8.43:6.8.eng: It’s possible that some woman or man who has observed the eight-factored sabbath will—when their body breaks up, after death—be reborn in the company of the gods who control what is created by others.

an8.43:6.9.pli: Idaṃ kho panetaṃ, visākhe, sandhāya bhāsitaṃ:
an8.43:6.9.eng: This is what I was referring to when I said:

an8.43:6.10.eng: ‘Human kingship is a poor thing compared to the happiness of the gods.’

an8.43:7.1.eng: You shouldn’t kill living creatures, or steal,

an8.43:7.2.pli: Musā na bhāse na ca majjapo siyā;

an8.43:7.4.eng: and don’t eat at night, the wrong time.

an8.43:8.1.pli: Mālaṃ na dhāre na ca gandhamācare,
an8.43:8.1.eng: Not wearing garlands or applying fragrance,

an8.43:8.2.eng: you should sleep on a low bed, <j>or a mat on the ground.

an8.43:8.3.eng: This is the eight-factored sabbath, they say,

an8.43:8.4.eng: explained by the Buddha, <j>who has gone to suffering’s end.

an8.43:9.1.pli: Cando ca suriyo ca ubho sudassanā,
an8.43:9.1.eng: The moon and sun are both fair to see,

an8.43:9.2.eng: radiating as far as they revolve.

an8.43:9.3.eng: Those dispellers of darkness, travellers in midair,

an8.43:9.4.eng: shine in the firmament, lighting up the quarters.

an8.43:10.1.eng: All of the wealth that’s found in this realm—

an8.43:11.1.eng: they’re not worth a sixteenth part

an8.43:11.2.eng: of the sabbath with its eight factors,

an8.43:11.3.eng: as starlight cannot rival the moon.

an8.43:12.1.pli: Tasmā hi nārī ca naro ca sīlavā,
an8.43:12.1.eng: So an ethical woman or man,

an8.43:12.2.eng: who has observed the eight-factored sabbath,

an8.43:12.3.eng: having made merit whose outcome is happiness,

an8.43:12.4.eng: blameless, they go to a heavenly place.”

an8.44:1.1.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā vesāliyaṃ viharati mahāvane kūṭāgārasālāyaṃ.
an8.44:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying near Vesālī, at the Great Wood, in the hall with the peaked roof.

an8.44:1.2.pli: Atha kho vāseṭṭho upāsako yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho vāseṭṭhaṃ upāsakaṃ bhagavā etadavoca:
an8.44:1.2.eng: Then the layman Vāseṭṭha went up to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down to one side. The Buddha said to him:

an8.44:1.3.eng: “Vāseṭṭha, the observance of the sabbath with its eight factors is very fruitful and beneficial and brilliant and bountiful …

an8.44:1.4.eng: blameless, they go to a heavenly place.”

an8.44:2.1.pli: Evaṃ vutte, vāseṭṭho upāsako bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
an8.44:2.1.eng: When he said this, Vāseṭṭha said to the Buddha:

an8.44:2.2.pli: “piyā me, bhante, ñātisālohitā aṭṭhaṅgasamannāgataṃ uposathaṃ upavaseyyuṃ, piyānampi me assa ñātisālohitānaṃ dīgharattaṃ hitāya sukhāya.
an8.44:2.2.eng: “If my loved ones—relatives and kin—were to observe this sabbath with its eight factors, it would be for their lasting welfare and happiness.

an8.44:2.3.pli: Sabbe cepi, bhante, khattiyā aṭṭhaṅgasamannāgataṃ uposathaṃ upavaseyyuṃ, sabbesampissa khattiyānaṃ dīgharattaṃ hitāya sukhāya. Sabbe cepi, bhante, brāhmaṇā …pe… vessā … suddā aṭṭhaṅgasamannāgataṃ uposathaṃ upavaseyyuṃ, sabbesampissa suddānaṃ dīgharattaṃ hitāya sukhāyā”ti.
an8.44:2.3.eng: If all the aristocrats, brahmins, peasants, and menials were to observe this sabbath with its eight factors, it would be for their lasting welfare and happiness.”

an8.44:3.1.eng: “That’s so true, Vāseṭṭha! That’s so true, Vāseṭṭha!

an8.44:3.2.pli: Sabbe cepi, vāseṭṭha, khattiyā aṭṭhaṅgasamannāgataṃ uposathaṃ upavaseyyuṃ, sabbesampissa khattiyānaṃ dīgharattaṃ hitāya sukhāya. Sabbe cepi, vāseṭṭha, brāhmaṇā …pe… vessā … suddā aṭṭhaṅgasamannāgataṃ uposathaṃ upavaseyyuṃ, sabbesampissa suddānaṃ dīgharattaṃ hitāya sukhāya.
an8.44:3.2.eng: If all the aristocrats, brahmins, peasants, and menials were to observe this sabbath with its eight factors, it would be for their lasting welfare and happiness.

an8.44:3.3.pli: Sadevako cepi, vāseṭṭha, loko samārako sabrahmako sassamaṇabrāhmaṇī pajā sadevamanussā aṭṭhaṅgasamannāgataṃ uposathaṃ upavaseyyuṃ, sadevakassapissa lokassa samārakassa sabrahmakassa sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya dīgharattaṃ hitāya sukhāya.
an8.44:3.3.eng: If the whole world—with its gods, Māras, and divinities, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, gods and humans—were to observe this sabbath with its eight factors, it would be for their lasting welfare and happiness.

an8.44:3.4.pli: Ime cepi, vāseṭṭha, mahāsālā aṭṭhaṅgasamannāgataṃ uposathaṃ upavaseyyuṃ, imesampissa mahāsālānaṃ dīgharattaṃ hitāya sukhāya (…).
an8.44:3.4.eng: If these great sal trees were to observe this sabbath with its eight factors, it would be for their lasting welfare and happiness—if they were sentient.

an8.44:3.5.eng: How much more then a human being!”
